results.title: Fitzroy: coming up for air
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An overview of aspects of life in Fitzroy, an inner-city suburb of Melbourne, where there are a large number of Housing Commission high-rise blocks of flats. Residents and people working in the community discuss the quality of life in Fitzroy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Dodds and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Fitzroy
results.brief_description: Shows the great difficulties and final success of climbing the South East buttress of Mount Fitzroy in South America in 1968. The early part of the film discusses Captain Robert Fitzroy, who explored the coast of Argentina, and his naturalist Charles Darwin who did extensive work in Patagonia.

results.title: Fitting the job to the worker: an introduction to ergonomics
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Frank A. Hoare, British Productivity Council and Merton Park
results.brief_description: An introduction to industrial ergonomics, a subject covering the study of all factors affecting the physical and psychological relationship between man and his artificial environment, including such factors as lighting, display, heat and sound, and age.

results.title: Fitting and machining
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A qualified fitter and machinist may go on to become a toolmaker, a works foreman or a draughtsman, or he may rise to executive level in a company. The status of professional engineeer can be achieved by those who complete a diploma course. Shows tradesmen at work with various mechanical tools, such as the lathe, grinder and milling machine.

results.title: Fit to fight
results.creator_credit: Gordon Stewart, Ronald H. Riley, Army Kinema Corporation and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: The physical training of the British Army, showing how it is carefully planned to help every recruit to reach his own individual peak of fitness. Explains the necessity for this high standard of physical well-being by showing how the training relates to different activities in the field.

results.title: Fishing the lake country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt shows some attractive fishing spots in Sydney and Mallacoota before going to the Gippsland Lakes. All through the film he gives hints on fishing, as well as discussing the ups and downs of the sport.

results.title: Fishing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Alcheringa”.
Illustrates the fishing methods of some Australian First Nations people, shown fishing on a lake using three-pronged spears from bark canoes. With Bill Onus.

results.title: The Fishermen of Quintay
results.brief_description: The Chilean Government’s decision that life in the isolated fishing villages must be improved brought two visitors - a Chilean Inspector of Fisheries and a UN Fisheries expert to the village of Quintay. The people of this community were anxious for progress, but they could do little to help due to poverty. The UN expert suggested that the fishermen form a co-operative for selling their fish and buying supplies. As a result life in this remote Chilean village has been raised to a new level.
